alert.note: Alert for Blount; Calhoun; Etowah; Jefferson; Shelby; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 10 at 12:44AM CST until December 10 at 1:30AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Blount County in central Alabama... Northwestern Calhoun County in east central Alabama... North central Shelby County in central Alabama... Western Etowah County in northeastern Alabama... Northeastern Jefferson County in central Alabama... St. Clair County in central Alabama... * Until 130 AM CST. * At 1244 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Inland Lake to Argo to near Bald Rock, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. Numerous trees were reported down in the Hoover and Vestavia Hills areas. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Northeastern Birmingham, Gadsden, Vestavia Hills, Mountain Brook, Trussville, Gardendale, Pell City, Irondale, Leeds, Moody, Rainbow City, Oneonta, Attalla, Springville, Odenville, Dallas, Center Point, Clay, Pinson, and Tarrant. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for central and northeastern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CST for central and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Blount; Calhoun; Etowah; Jefferson; Shelby; St. Clair
